Single-host with structured (continuous) host population

Source: R/single-continuous.R
singleContinuous.Rd

This function runs a single-host transmission chain simulation, with a structured host population (such as spatial features). The simulation stops either at the end of given time (specified by length.sim) or when the number of hosts infected threshold (max.infected) is passed.

singleContinuous(length.sim, max.infected, init.individuals,
  init.structure, structure.raster, diff.pMove = FALSE,
  timeDep.pMove = FALSE, pMove, param.pMove, diff.sdMove = FALSE,
  timeDep.sdMove = FALSE, sdMove, param.sdMove,
  attracted.by.raster = FALSE, diff.nContact = FALSE,
  timeDep.nContact = FALSE, nContact, param.nContact,
  diff.pTrans = FALSE, timeDep.pTrans = FALSE, pTrans, param.pTrans,
  diff.pExit = FALSE, timeDep.pExit = FALSE, pExit, param.pExit,
  prefix.host = "H", progress.bar = TRUE, print.step = 10)

Arguments

length.sim

specifies the length (in unit of time) over which the simulation should be run.
max.infected

specifies the maximum number of hosts that can be infected in the simulation.
init.individuals

number of initially infected individuals.
init.structure

which state (i.e. location) the initially infected individuals are located.
structure.raster

raster object defining the environmental variable.
diff.pMove

is pMove different between states of the structured population (TRUE/FALSE)
timeDep.pMove

is pMove dependant on the absolute time of the simulation (TRUE/FALSE)
pMove

function that gives the probability of a host moving as a function of time.
param.pMove

parameter names (list of functions) for the pMove.
diff.sdMove

is sdMove dependant on the environmental value (TRUE/FALSE).
timeDep.sdMove

is sdMove dependant on the absolute time of the simulation (TRUE/FALSE).
sdMove

function that gives the distance travelled (based on coordinates); gives the sd value for the brownian motion.
param.sdMove

parameter names (list of functions) for sdMove
attracted.by.raster

should the hosts be attracted by high values in the environmental raster? (TRUE/FALSE)
diff.nContact

is nContact different between states of the structured population (TRUE/FALSE)
timeDep.nContact

is nContact dependant on the absolute time of the simulation (TRUE/FALSE)
nContact

function that gives the number of potential transmission events per unit of time.
param.nContact

parameter names (list of functions) for nContact.
diff.pTrans

is pTrans different between states of the structured population (TRUE/FALSE)
timeDep.pTrans

is pTrans dependant on the absolute time of the simulation (TRUE/FALSE)
pTrans

function that gives the probability of transmit a pathogen as a function of time since infection.
param.pTrans

parameter names (list of functions) for the pTrans.
diff.pExit

is pExit different between states of the structured population (TRUE/FALSE)
timeDep.pExit

is pExit dependant on the absolute time of the simulation (TRUE/FALSE)
pExit

function that gives the probability to exit the simulation for an infected host (either moving out, dying, etc.).
param.pExit

parameter names (list of functions) for the pExit.
prefix.host

character(s) to be used as a prefix for the hosts identification number.
progress.bar

if TRUE, print message on simulation state to screen.
print.step

progress.bar is TRUE, step with which the progress message will be printed.

Contents

  • Arguments
